document.text: Chinese word segmentation ( CWS ) is a necessary step in Chinese-English statisti cal machine translation ( SMT ) and its per formance has an impact on the results of SMT .
However , there are many settings in volved in creating a CWS system such as various specifications and CWS methods .
This paper investigates the effect of these settings to SMT .

document.evidence: We tested dictionary based and CRF-based approaches and found there was no significant difference between the two in the qualty of the result ing translations .

This paper also proposes two methods of combining advantages of different specifications : a simple concatenation of training data and a feature interpolation approach in which the same types of features of translation models from various CWS schemes are linearly interpolated .

document.evidence: We found these ap proaches were very effective in improving quality of translations .

document.evidence: We investigated the effect of CWS on SMT from two points of view .
document.text: We investigated the effect of CWS on SMT from two points of view .
Firstly , we analyzed multiple CWS specifications and built a CWS for each one to examine how they affected translations .

document.evidence: Secondly , we investigated the advantages and disadvantages of various CWS approaches , both dictionary-based and CRF-based , and built CWSs using these approaches to examine their effect on translations .
